website_summaries.verdict: Very simple holder to use at an extremely low price.
pros: Good quality at a great price
cons: While large enough for most spinning and freshwater rods, this holder is too small to accommodate larger rods
You'll need a bank or other soft dirt surface to use this option

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Kayak milk crate.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these on my kayak milk crate and I couldn't more pleased with them. There are two reasons that make them perfect for a milk crate. 1. They don't have the reel slot like most other rod tubes do so your long rod handles don't go all the way to the deck. 2. They are the same width as a milk crate, so they are the perfect size. So, yak fishermen these will work well on your fishing rig.
customer_reviews.author: B. OwenTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: These were simple to install and work great. I worry that the hard molded foam will not hold up over time, but I am careful as I put the rods in and out. (TWSS). Easy to install and do the job. I don't have a picture of it in use, but I do have a great picture of all my girls fishing, so you can see why I need to be able to store multiple fishing rods. UPDATE: got a better picture.
customer_reviews.author: PMO

customer_reviews.title: I did have to use some wall anchors on some of them but I am very pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I used one section to hold the rods and rested the butt of the rods on the floor. Was able to buy two sets and put 24 rods using this method. I did have to use some wall anchors on some of them but I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Captain C

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: Got my rods, reels and some amateur radio antennas off the floor. Adding a fly rod was a challenge so I used the top of one of the mounts, and added a nail to steady it a bit. A good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J.

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Rapala
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after owning two of the Rapala rod holders because it was "cheaper" ..... well it is indeed "cheaper" in every sense of the word. The foam is difficult to navigate and eventually falls out..... I have ordered another of the Rapala rod holders and recommend you do the same ( in my photo the far right holder shows the foam missing where it fell out)
customer_reviews.author: gatorbuilder

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but foam too stiff
customer_reviews.text: These are very affordable, which is nice - their construction seems decent enough, however as other reviews have mentioned, the foam is too firm, and rods have to be SHOVED in. They are also pretty tightly packed, so if you have reels on while storing, you're unlikely to get 5, let alone 6 full rods into the shelving. I'm able to get 4 rods with reels in, plus one rod without. Due to the extra-stiff foam, there's some additional tension on the unit if you're pulling rods off, and I've had issues with them coming out of the wall and ripping the drywall (screws included are too short to reach the studs).
customer_reviews.author: J. PearsonTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fishing pole holder for the garage
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what the Dr. ordered!!! This is what I was looking for. I had all my poles in a corner and all tangled, not anymore. The fishing pole holder is made of metal and foam. For the price, you can't beat this. Why spend more when this one does the job?
customer_reviews.author: Steelers fan

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you measure the base of your rod
customer_reviews.text: This only worked on one of my rods, the light action one. Too small for my 7 foot rods and needs to be bent out somehow
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It's a fishing rod holder, attaches to the surface ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a fishing rod holder, attaches to the surface via screws, it holds fishing rods that about sums it up
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great for fishing off the bank
customer_reviews.text: I usually fish off the bank and the local ponds or lakes. This rod holder is super convenient for holding my baited rod when I have two rods with me. It's cheap, easy to shove into the ground and seems sturdy. I've used it on many fishing trips and it hasn't yet pulled out or dropped my rod, even when I get a bite. The price helped made it a pretty easy choice!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe C.

customer_reviews.title: Very handy rod rack.
customer_reviews.text: Great rod holder for my needs. I installed it on my shed’s ceiling. I only wished they were cheaper like the big store (bass pro .....) they have them for $9.99 and they are identical but with a different brand stamp. It is still a good deal at $13.18. Note: The part that holds the tip side of the rod may be very tight for beefy rods so make sure you are gentle when storing/removing your rods and your rod holder should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P.

customer_reviews.title: Bring your own screws.
customer_reviews.text: The rod holder is ok, quaility just as good as you would as you would find manufactured in China or Pakistan. I'm giving a one star rating because these rod holders are shipped with dirt cheap flatblade screws, which when trying to mount these are incredibly frustrating. For the same cost they could have included Phillips or square or whatever would have been better. Bring your own screws.
customer_reviews.author: psgenius

customer_reviews.title: This works great but know your rod.
customer_reviews.text: This works great but the problem i had was several of my rods are to thick to fit in the holder. It also only keeps your rod vertical. I ended up buying a two pack that is adjustable and holds all the rods. Cost about $10 more than this but holds everything from saltwater, catfish and normal freshwater rods plus you can change the angles of your rod. If you don't need all that then this will work for your normal rod like a Zebco 33.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: sweet
customer_reviews.text: now this is a good buy!! lost my first pair in santa cruz and i was pissed at myself for leaving it there so i told myself i wasn't gonna buy 2 more as punishment to mysel. i bough them at bass pro shops for 8 a piece i was doing some browsing and couldn't beieive how cheap they were so i took myself off restriction and bought them . super strong tight fit remember they are for small lake poles!
customer_reviews.author: Jack C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Buy the horizontal setup and use vertically!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, bought one horizontal set and used it vertically to hold twice the amount of rods!
customer_reviews.author: Yak Toyo

customer_reviews.title: Room For Improvement but Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: For the low price, I guess it's a decent rod holder. I do have a few concerns. Any rod thicker than an average light-weight or mid-weight fresh water rod will be a very tight fit, and might not fit at all. For example, my surf fishing rod won't fit. The included screws are troublesome for two reasons. First, they are flatheads instead of philips heads. Flathead screws are just harder to install. Second, even though I screwed directly into wall studs, they didn't grip very well because they are too short. They barely grabbed solid wood after accounting for the drywall thickness. Use longer wood screws.
customer_reviews.author: Sail Away

customer_reviews.title: Great rod holder
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent rod holder. The foam is a little stiff but does well holding the rods. I bought 2 of them so I had more room for my 8 rods. I also used my own screws instead of ones included to make sure the rack was not going anywhere. Took about 5 minutes to install both of them. Well worth the money and keeps my rods out of the floor. Pros: Holds rods securely Easy to install Wells Made Cons: Foam is a little stiff
customer_reviews.author: Brian Allyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For My Kayak Milk Crate
customer_reviews.text: This simple tube rod rack has been a great addition to my kayak milk crate. It's strong, super lightweight, and I'm able to store additional poles and a net in the tubes. Installing the rack onto the crate was a cinch. Although the rack isn't the cheapest, I highly recommend this product or one similar to it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K. Wickersham

customer_reviews.title: Secure them up high!
customer_reviews.text: I am always looking for ways to keep my poles safe and out of the way. With a little ingenuity you can too. I have three sets of these screwed to my ceiling in my garage. Who likes their $200-$300 rod and reel setups sitting in a corner with lines tangling, kids knocking them over, and the possibility of breaking something? NO ONE! So why not drill out the base side, slide those poles through, and put these up and out of the way. For the price, isn't it worth your time to put them up so no one knocks them down. Sure, you can use these on your boat if you want to, but I suggest the ceiling/
customer_reviews.author: Kelly O.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but worth the money if it works for you
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it's a $10 rack ($6.67 for me since I got on a deal day). And that's what you get, a $10 rack. It works, it ain't pretty. My biggest issue is my blue water rods are too big for this setup. This will work best with smaller rods and especially smaller reels, since the reels tend to jam into each other meaning you can only use 3 of the 6 slots. But it's still a good buy for the money if it suits your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Queens Determination

customer_reviews.title: Could use a pointy end to make it easier to stick in the ground
customer_reviews.text: My son and I bought three of these to use when fishing from the bank. I had gotten tired of the line always getting caught in the weeds when we laid the poles down. The only improvement that needs to be made is to sharpen the end that sticks into the ground. They work okay as delivered, but I think they would slide past pebbles and small rocks better if the end was sharpened. A file or angle grinder can fix this small issue quickly though.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Bean

customer_reviews.title: Reasons for 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start off by saying that everything in the description is true. The reason I gave this product 3 stars are for a couple of reason. Reason 1 is because straight out of the box one of the rails had a crack on the corner, not sure how it happened but it still works. I just don’t think the rails will last as long anymore. Reason 2: the second reason has to do with the spaces. It doesn’t seem like you can fit all of your fishing rods with the reel comfortably without them getting tangled together. All in all it’s a good product for the money, just little things they can improve on that caught my eye.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC ROD HOLDER
customer_reviews.text: This rod holder is secure, attractive, fits all my rods (freshwater) and goes into the ground with great ease. I am very glad that the end is NOT pointy because it would likely go through the fabric of my packs. the way it is designed is perfect: Just the right height to carry readily yet still keep even my 7'3" fishing pole steadily upright even in a wind and rain storm. Plus it is really cool looking. I bought two and I may get a couple more. But that is only in case I lose one because these are likely to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: aminahyaquin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rack for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I got nothing bad to say. I used other racks before which look good and its triple the price. But being that I was unable to adjust the height, it was pretty useless. This rack actually works for my purposes. I am able to mount rods that have very long handles (surf rods) and short handles because I am able to mount it at my own custom length.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Perfect for small spaces. Organize your fishing rods!
customer_reviews.text: These do exactly what they are supposed to do- hold rods. I installed them vertically in a truly useless portion of the garage. They don’t take up any space. It started me on the path to keep our things more organized. Every time we go fishing it was the same hours and hours of detangling. Now they are neat and tidy! Same as some of the other reviews stated, I was worried that the foam that holds them in place would eventually give , but they really seem secure. I would recommend and I would also give us a gift - which I am for my dad, so I hope he isn’t reading this!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: No reel cut out
customer_reviews.text: I put these rod holders on my metal wagon for a recent beach fishing trip. They seem well made and should hold up over time. My only problem with them is they do not have a cut out for the reel. I did take my husbands dremel and cut out slots for the reels.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B

customer_reviews.title: Like the twist lok feature
customer_reviews.text: Installed in the bed cap of a long bed Tacoma (ARE topper). Angled the rods so I could fit my longer rods in the bed. Like the twist lok feature. I also put the 'holed' side towards the cab so I can slide the rods in (reel side near cab) from outside the bed and then lock the rods in without having to climb into the bed. Holds everything securely.
customer_reviews.author: DIYDADDY

customer_reviews.title: No foam replacement available
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly stowing rods in boat, but the foam inserts don’t hold up to repeated use. The inserts are not available for order, so I have made them from foam pipe insulation a couple times. I have decided to order another set of rod holders ,so I can make the foam inserts at my convenience and change out when needed. I’m waiting on the clearance sales after hunting season ends to buy a reduced price foam hunting pad to cut up and try for foam replacements.
customer_reviews.author: deere2320

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I have used similar rod holders for a long time, and the plastic/foam that you push the rod through is different on this holder than ones I have used in the past. With this holder it is a little more difficult to insert the rod than with others I have used. It seems a little "stickier". I might try a little teflon spray to see if it helps, but it does work as is, so no biggy. I am still glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great product itself, hardware given is a joke though!
customer_reviews.text: The product itself works fine and as described. However, the hardware they give you for installing the 2 pieces are a joke. Who sends flat head screws with ANYTHING that is to be hung in drywall or wood? I did more damage to my 2 rod holders trying to get them hung because the flat head bit kept sliding out and taking chunks out of the plastic/polymer moldings. Do yourself a favor, grab some 1/2" black phillips head screws and save yourself 15 minutes of streaming obscenities. Come back from 1990 Berkley!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Kremer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price while on sale.  Works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: In bought three of these to organize all my spinning and bait casting rods and reels and set up a “fishing station” on my back porch. Very pleased. I used aircraft safety wire to attach to the shelf and tap cons into the brick for the others.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for rods only, but not rods with reels
customer_reviews.text: If you wanted to leave reels on then you’d need to alternate directions to prevent the reels interfering with each other, and even then there would be problems with the reels and rods making contact, and also the fact that the rods would bend due to the weight of the reels. You need to support the rod handles to store rods with reels on, and the holes in this rack are far too small for that.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: It does not work. As thin as a fishing pole is, the pole takes extreme effort to slide into the foam of the rod holder slot. This sounds absurd, but is absolutely true. I thought maybe if i get it in a few times, it would loosen up - Well, the foam starts to break apart when you add the amount of effort required to get a pole in it. Still sounds absurd, huh?! How could somebody mess up such a simple design?! I dunno, but they managed to. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact rod organizer
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to hang my rods up away from my dogs' reach. I used to take hooks off because I feared my dogs would go sniffing around my poles and get hooked. This holder lets me put them well out of their reach and keep them from tangling together. The foam inserts expand to hold thicker rods.
customer_reviews.author: B.T.S.Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Warped-Molding Issues
customer_reviews.text: It's been molded in a way to where one side pulls from the wall. As soon as you screw it flat in place, the warped material pulls the left screw our of wall. Had to rescrew it, after it pulled from the wall. Had to add an anchor- still did not work. Finally had to scoot it over and drill one side into a stud. Thought about returning it, but wasn't worth the 4min drive from the house.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great storage for my fishing poles
customer_reviews.text: This product is very easy to install, and has been great holding my Fishing rod's. I highly recommend this product or even the vertical one Berkley sells. The screws are a little short for getting through drywall, but I had some handy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Spacing between reels isnt enough no matter how you mow them around.
customer_reviews.text: Never send standard screw head screws to install! Always needs to be Phillips screw head screws. So toss the screws that come with the rod holders. Next each rod holder holds 6 rods well you dont have the spacing between reels if you use all 6 so I used 5 spots. See attached pic. So I dont really care for them but at least know their not sitting in the corner all bunched up. I bought 5 of these and just installed 1 so far and really not satisfied. Now getting ready to install the 2nd one and find this. So thinking I can fix it and then it breaks! Come on Berkley!! Definitely not getting my money's worth now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job...
customer_reviews.text: I've had earlier versions of this rod rack and all have generally been the same. The setup is a bit "tight" (all 5 spaces will be accessible if reels/handles line up correctly) but it's not designed to be anything else. I believe the screws that are supplied could be a bit longer as users should show some care when removing rods so as not to pull screws from drywall, etc. I'd recommend using anchors if you anticipate significant use or hard pulling will take place. For the price, the rack system is fine.
customer_reviews.author: LWWInMN

customer_reviews.title: Great rod rack for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to get all my rods organized in the garage. This vertical rod rack was simple, cheap, and for them on done. I ordered a second rod rack after installing the first one. You can't beat the price. I would rate this 5 stars, but the inserts are very close together making it difficult to store my bigger offshore rods. The mounting screws are flathead screws, not phillips head screws. Not a big deal. I would still recommend this rod rack because of the great price.
customer_reviews.author: Rob512350

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rod Holder
customer_reviews.text: My 15' Boston Whaler Striper has had this Berkeley rod holder on since new in 1978 and it just died on our last trip to the Southern Sierras...pretty impressive! Granted the boat has been covered when not in use, but I would say that is a very solid return on my investment. Not as tough as stainless steel, but not as expensive either.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Inman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for Carp Fishing. They are fantastic. I would say not all rods fit into these but overall i love them! I actually have 8 in total now. My FavoriteUSA Rods and Okuma Citrix fit great. My Okuma TCS Rods do not fit well (But you can squeeze them in. If you are looking to do some Catfishing or Carp Fishing, i would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Pennell

customer_reviews.title: A good value and a good solution.  I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: They are solidly built and I am sure will do the job. I probably would have preferred a reel notch, but I could probably dremel one if I fee its a big deal. Came with hardware, but like most others who are attaching them to a Kayak crate, I used zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pires

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: They're just okay. Like other reviewers have stated, the slots should have been spaced further apart. Also, the manufacturer needs to at least get in the 20th century as the screws were flat head screws. Who even uses those? I doubt I'll keep these for long before I just build a better system of my own out of wood.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Almost. Berkeley had it in the Red Zone. But they came up short.
customer_reviews.text: Studs are 16" apart, right? Guess how far apart they put the mounting holes. 13"! So, you will need to mount two boards to the studs, then mount the racks to the boards. Berkeley is a good company. But their design on this one is 3" too short. And that extra width would help keep the reels from being overcrowded, too. Next time, guys. ￼ ￼ ￼
customer_reviews.author: D. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Prime day sale, so these were priced super cheap so I bought 2 to store 10 various rod and reels. I was trying to build my own with some scrap wood and PVC from a different project. My only dislike is how close together the holders are, its kind of tight to fit 6 rods into each one. Setup was simple, all the hardware you need is in the box. The upper slots are some kind of foam that holds the rods very snugly, very happy with the outcome, and way easier than what I was trying to build. If you need a thing to hold your rods, this will certainly get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya D

customer_reviews.title: This Fishing Rod Rack rocks!
customer_reviews.text: To use unused space, I attached this to the garage door to hold the rods horizontally (Vertically would have been dumb, right)? The rack moves with the garage door up and down several times a day w/o any rods falling out. The rods do slide back and forth a bit, so I'll have to find a solution to that (rubber bands?). The latter movement issue might come into play if mounted in a boat or truck, as examples.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pasieka

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap feeling BUT they work
customer_reviews.text: Looking for an inexpensive way to hang a few rods - this is one option They work! The ones I received are kinda warped - but they work One thing I don’t like - why doesn’t everything come default at 16 inches ? I’m a stud junkie (no that’s not some code for something weird? But I like to fasten things I. My walls into actual studs - but nothing seems to come standard length for standard framing - oh well...
customer_reviews.author: pJackson

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pole holders for a great deal and I use them all the time when I'm fishing with more than one pole at a time. I have several poles spread out with these holders & when I get a bite the pole moves but never comes close to coming out of the holder.
customer_reviews.author: STEVIE

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price. Fasteners are TERRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: These are decent quality... I wish the slots were spaced out more as you can never really put a rod in each slot with the reels still on... but here's my one major gripe, the screws to install these are flat-head screws - seriously? It took me forever to install cause the bit kept slipping out of the screw head... Come on now! It's the 21st century! give us a modern fastener!
customer_reviews.author: ZachMac

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Great pruduct!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my fiance's oldest son. He loves fishing. This keeps them out of the way. He used to keep them in the middle of his floor and they would get stepped on by him. Now he steps on them in the middle of the floor and breaks them while looking at this perfect rack that's mounted to his f*ing wall (perfectly level I might add) and sobs, all while I point at this f^#<!ng rack that is STILl PErFeCTly mounted to the _@^#:=g wall just a few F@%=*=,& feet away! CHRIST aLL MIgHTY!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Look for some better screws
customer_reviews.text: The screws that come with these racks are not good enough for dry wall. Too short. Plan on getting larger screws with the red plastic dry wall anchors. The cell foam that grips the rods is very tight, so I can see pulling the whole thing down when you go to grab a rod off this rack.
customer_reviews.author: GunnyGrandad

customer_reviews.title: Berkley, Fix the one thing...please.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a five stars except for one item. The screws that come with this are flathead or slotted type. That is a giant pain in the ass all around. You could put anything else in there and it would be better. I used some stainless screws and problem solved but I think it would either be fix that or leave out. Otherwise, this works great for storing rods in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: MNPilot

customer_reviews.title: Just about worthless to me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep the rods on my boat still while transporting / fishing. It is so hard to put a rod in / take one out of these holders I felt as if they would break every time I tried. I switched to rod savers and haven't looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Chem Guy

customer_reviews.title: Overall, good product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to hold 8 rods with reels. Installed them side by side. As stated in another review, use your own screws. The ones that come with the product are too small and don't come with sheet rock anchors. I was able to place several rods side by side. If you have large reels, you may have to skip a rod space. Sturdiness is sufficient, but you need to use proper screws.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A too-small rod holder!
customer_reviews.text: I never did actually use this rod holder for its intended purpose (holding a fishing rod when bank fishing), because none of my several spinning rods would fit into the coils of the device. In order to use this device, your rod handle can't be much more than an inch in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Rafe

customer_reviews.title: Good value rod holder
customer_reviews.text: Use it when fishing from shore at my local lake. Needed something like this for lazy days when I just want to throw something out, sit down, and enjoy nature while waiting for bites. Works well, sturdy, and does the job. Obviously there are better ones out there but not for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Yim

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money! I gave it 3 stars on “easy to install” due to the fact that it came with flat head screws to mount. I just replaced those with Phillips head screws and it was super simple to install. Decent quality plastic that’s sturdy. Not the greatest if you want to fill all 6 spots with the reels on though, but with a little maneuvering you can do it. I’m glad to know that my fishing poles are not on the ground, and I don’t need to worry about them falling off the wall.
customer_reviews.author: hcnuprekcus71

customer_reviews.title: the foam that is used looks like it is made from recycled foam pieces
customer_reviews.text: These will hold your fishing rods. However, I’m tired of products that used to be synonymous with quality, (Berkley) dialing back on pride with which they make their products. These are a bit flimsy and are hollow on the back so the foam is exposed leaving only the holes at either end to mount them. Also, the foam that is used looks like it is made from recycled foam pieces, time will tell if they will last. It would be nice if they were constructed with a solid back in case you needed to run screws in them from Behind to back mount them as in my case.
customer_reviews.author: dirty one

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately did not review the exact size of the rod holders and they are too long for the space where we wanted to install them in our boat. My husband thinks he can use them in our storage shed to store the rods when we put away our boat. My mistake - should have read it over closer. We are keeping them as they are well made and will do the trick for us in the shed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Delhenty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Storage
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect way to store your rods in your garage or other room. They keep them up and out of the way so they do not get broken or ruined. I no longer have rods stood in the corner getting knocked over or laying across shelves. These made great use of empty wall space. I would highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you have smaller diameter freshwater rods
customer_reviews.text: It's only made for smaller rods, and I have a good mix of salt water and fresh water rod and reels so I can only use it for a freshwater rods.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Teel

customer_reviews.title: Securely holds my fishing rods
customer_reviews.text: I think for the money this is a good product. I do wish that they would have used a different type of foam. Time will tell how well the foam holds up. I have seen complaints about the screws. In my opinion this is quite silly. All one has to do is drill a pilot hole in the board. From this point use a flat head screwdriver and attach the screws. The unit seems solid enough and holds my fishing rods securely. I noticed on the packaging it says Made in the USA. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B.

customer_reviews.title: fishing pole holders
customer_reviews.text: exactly what i ordered. my boys love them! They put them on the wall behind their room doors. rods are safe and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Lj

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say
customer_reviews.text: It holds fishing rods and it was easy enough to install in the garage. I just eyeballed the location and used a level to make sure it was level and haven't had any issues. Just get your drill and screw the screws into the holes. Hard to mess it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good fishing rod holder
customer_reviews.text: Great fishing rod holder, wish there were a couple more spots or possibly spaced out a little bit other than that it great! Super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Shyann Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: Great catch!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pleased with the product and purchase! I wanted to surprise my husband as he returns home from deployment and this took my surprise to another level! Lol caring for his garage and fishing poles. I purchased the horizontal pieces and used the garage floor as a base! Easy to install and the poles are secure! I didn’t have any problems!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. J. Olivier

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Happy with it, would buy again. As others have stated, the foam is a bit stiff but I find that a little twisting of the rod while rocking it in or out does the trick. I have it set up in my truck topper so it will see a lot of heat. Seems solid enough but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Yeah, .... right

customer_reviews.title: Simple but does the trick
customer_reviews.text: All in all my husband is happy with them, but it’s hard to use all of the slots because the reels get in the way since they’re so close together. Also, the plastic is cheap and a little warped, so I was afraid they might crack when I was screwing them in, but they didn’t. They went up fine and look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap affordable and Morty investment for the price great for organizing fishing rods
customer_reviews.text: Cheap affordable easy to wall mount and Assemble and organized are fishing rods definitely worth the investment for the price
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Pulido

customer_reviews.title: rod storage
customer_reviews.text: These are great for storing rods on your boat. Had to take off 1 star if you have them set to fit towards the real seat they are a little to tight IMO. So if you keep them towards the tip and mid section on the rod they seem to me easier to insert rods.
customer_reviews.author: ezreader

customer_reviews.title: Space Saver
customer_reviews.text: The Berkley Fish Rod Racks were easy to install on my garage wall. Great space saver to get the fishing rods out of the corner and organized, so as not to waste space or damage said rods. I especially like the foam insert on the top rack to grip the rods and keep them from falling on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: William Casey

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Functional
customer_reviews.text: This isn't anything fancy, but it looks good and does the job perfectly. I had a pile of fishing poles in the corner of my room. They looked like a pile of garbage. When cleaned up and hung on the rack, they look like display items. It's a huge improvement to the look of my room.
customer_reviews.author: bd_doolin

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty sturdy and not hard to install at all but the screws they include are chincy...plan on getting your own small drywall anchors and screws but over all its decent. I'd buy it again, its nice having my poles organized and not in a corner or the garage.
customer_reviews.author: kim s

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for RV
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who owns an RV knows that organization is crucial. I needed a secure, out of the way place to store my rod(s). Note that there is a lock ring on the open side so that it doesn’t have to rely on friction alone.
customer_reviews.author: Moore

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: Finally no more rods falling over in the corner! So easy to install and keeps the rods off the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Howard

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done in a pinch. Sometimes ...
customer_reviews.text: They get the job done in a pinch. Sometimes it's a little difficult to insert larger rods into the foam, but I hung them last night and they seem to do their job. One of the foam inserts I received damaged (slightly crushed), but I just saved that slot for one of my bigger surfcasting setups. I also wish the screws that came with it were a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: dominick sciarretta

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: The rack works and holds my rods securely on my boat. I am not a fan of the foam that is used to hold the rods, as it's a large cell foam that does not hold up to the necessary flexing needed to get the rod in and out.
customer_reviews.author: K0PIE

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these on my boat along with 2 of the Attwood brand. They are so easy to install and so simple. They do seem to be a better fit for rods with bait cast reels as opposed to spinning reels. I cant wait 'till I get out on the lake and try them out. I saved about 3 dollars a piece thru Amazon and delivered in 2 days. Decent deal for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice light tackle rod holders.
customer_reviews.text: I love these rod holders. I throw them in my five gallon bucket with my bait and gear when light tackle fishing sod banks and river beaches. My back bay rods fit nicely in the holders. They would be too small for most surf rods.
customer_reviews.author: Doug G.

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 starts
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing crazy fancy but in a garage, who needs fancy right? Ok, maybe someone does but not me lol. Mounted these on the wall super easy. Only problem is they come with super short screws and no wall anchors. Had to use my own so not a problem but wont get 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: AJ R

customer_reviews.title: Good if you’re looking for long term storage
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for about 3 months now. Pros are that it’s inexpensive and does work to hold poles securely. The best use for this is if you don’t take your poles out that often. We live on a lake and I’m finding that the foam inserts which hold the poles are starting to wear and tear in some places due to regular loading and unloading of fishing poles. For my situation, a floor rack would have suited us better. I can’t see this lasting much past a year before all the foam starts to break apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Super basic.
customer_reviews.text: It holds poles just fine. Simple design. I don’t need anything fancy just something to stash poles on the wall. Works fine and easy to install. My only hiccup is the screws they provide are awful. They don’t screw into drywall with enough strength and there are no provided anchors. I had to use my own anchors and screws to make it hold and not rip out the drywall. Makes no sense to exclude anchors.
customer_reviews.author: Milt Drucker

customer_reviews.title: Great company they satisfy their customers!
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review earlier. This problem was resolved. The company worked with me and it’s no longer an issue. Wasn’t fond of the product but the company sure is nice and will take care of you if you do encounter a problem?
customer_reviews.author: Eddy Quillman

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have six of these rod holders that I mounted on the wall next to my boat. At the end of the trip I just reach out and store my rods for the next trip. They are well made, easy to install. I use them for both bait casting and spinning reels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds rods well.
customer_reviews.text: These really hold my ice rods well on the wall in my fish house. I can travel down the road with no issues. Rods are firm in their place. Yes I would buy again, best ones I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: diane hatlestad

customer_reviews.title: Great value, design just ok
customer_reviews.text: The spacing between the holes doesn’t really allow you to overlap open faced rods where the real is on the same side. They are designed with the intent to put all the reels on one side so it can create a challenge as the reals don’t fit. I’ll see what I can do is I fill up the rack.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a life saver for my son and his fishing gear. I was so fed up with fishing poles forever being in the way on my porch and this solved the problem. Now he has a dedicated place for his fishing poles that is out of the way and keeps them safe, and I can quit threatening to beat him with those same poles because they're cluttering up the place. Win/win!
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rod Holder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an add-on to my homemade kayak and pier fishing crate. It works really well and has been a really helpful addition. I like having a spot to put my scissors in addition to the added rod holder.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Fish

customer_reviews.title: foam already ripped a little
customer_reviews.text: I have these up on my wall in the garage to keep my poles up and out of the way. they look great. good design and once my poles are in they stay put. however, i recently took one out and the foam tooth ripped off. a little glue and its back in its place I just hope that this doesn't keep happening.
customer_reviews.author: JM Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold six rods with reels.
customer_reviews.text: The spacing is not good. I could only put three rods in with the reels attached. That was the point of buying this rack, not removing the reels. Also, I don’t know how long the foam is going to last. Get what you pay for and in reality this is fine for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Neff

customer_reviews.title: ... rod rack holder in any local stores and was pleased to be able find it in Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to find the 4 rod rack holder in any local stores and was pleased to be able find it in Amazon. The holder is exactly what I expected and meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Auggie

customer_reviews.title: Nice for price
customer_reviews.text: holds 6 rods if you take the reels of can only get 4 with them on. But for price it does what I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: shane irwin

customer_reviews.title: OK item
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of how they fit. The padding is so tight that when you put the pole in it almost tears it out. Hopefully over time it'll break in. Also the slots are to close together, the reels hit one another almost best to just use every other slot. All in all it works but will end up using for my kids smaller poles and will look for something different for the poles I use often.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Good size!!  6 banger!
customer_reviews.text: I have these mounted up in my basement ceiling between floor joists (unfinished). No problems with poles with reels staying up. The only thing that blows is the slotted head screw included!! slotted? really? come on man!
customer_reviews.author: Goodie

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works as advertised. Only complaint, have to work at it to place a rod into unit or to take rod out. Way to stiff. Kinda like hard styrofoam Center. Even then line on my reels gets stuck. The gap between the holding foam needs to be a tad larger. Overall it works.
customer_reviews.author: Dsimer

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for basic storage
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for out-of-sight (wife won't be happy if they're visible) storage. Mine are in a closet and it is ideal for basic storage. One con is the screws are good for attachment to a wood surface only. If going into sheet rock you'll need anchors and longer screws. Minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Cy Birr

customer_reviews.title: Great rod racks.
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of these in vertical, and horizontal. It's a good cheap well made rod rack. I kinda wish they came bigger though than 6 rod though. Anyways they are cheap enough to buy a bunch of them as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Quick n Easy
customer_reviews.text: Quick n easy to mount. I tossed the standard slot screws and used some longer wood screws. 1 rack works great for a vertical rack if you use the floor as the base, otherwise both make a horizontal rack.
customer_reviews.author: FT

customer_reviews.title: Screws provided too small
customer_reviews.text: Stiff Styrofoam holds the rods up. I'd recommend putting it against some type of ledge due to the small screws given. I switched it out for longer screws because they did not stay in the walls great.
customer_reviews.author: Darkx143

customer_reviews.title: Boom these work! Happy wife happy life...
customer_reviews.text: Are your fishing rods shoved in the corner of your garage and make you angry when they randomly fall over.....gets these and you won't have that problem..... Happy wife happy life ....
customer_reviews.author: Zac

product_meta.title: Berkley Spiral Fishing Rod Holder
feature_bullets: The Package Height Of The Product Is 1 Inches
The Package Length Of The Product Is 1 Inches
The Package Width Of The Product Is 1 Inches

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
